Display_Name: Building human resources
Description: The World Bank's Country Policy and Institutional Assessment (CPIA) assess the conduciveness of a country's policy and institutional framework to poverty reduction, sustainable growth, and the effective use of development assistance.

Display_Name: Electoral Democracies
Description: Freedom House is an independent watchdog organization dedicated to the expansion of freedom and democracy around the world. The report Freedom in the World is produced each year by a team of in-house and external analysts and expert advisers from the academic, think tank, and human rights communities.

Display_Name: Property rights (WEF)
Description:
The Global Competitiveness Report 2015–2016 presents information and data that were compiled and/or collected by the World Economic Forum.
It is grouped into 12 categories, the pillars of competitiveness: Institutions, Infrastructure, Macroeconomic environment, Health and primary education, Higher education and training, Goods market efficiency, Labor market efficiency, Financial market development, Technological readiness, Market size, Business sophistication, Innovation.

Description: The International Labour Organization is the only tripartite U.N. agency. It brings together governments, employers and workers of 187 member States , to set labour standards, develop policies and devise programmes promoting decent work for all women and men.

Display_Name: House of the People Bicameral
Description: The primary source of data is parliaments themselves. Every IPU member parliament has a correspondent who is responsible for providing information on changes and updates to the IPU Secretariat. Additional information is gathered from other sources, including national electoral commissions and the media, and is regularly cross-checked with parliament.

Description: PEFA includes 31 performance indicators across the broad array of PFM activities performed by governments. The indicators are grouped under the seven pillars. Each pillar comprises a group of indicators that capture the performance of the key systems, processes, and institutions of government.

Display_Name: National Accounts Base Year
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Access to Government Information
Description: The Sustainable Governance Indicators (SGI) draw on established survey and aggregation methods. In order to ensure the proper operationalization of the individual index components, the SGI relies on a combination of qualitative and quantitative data.

Display_Name: Rank
Description:
The CPI 2017 is calculated using 13 different data sources from 12 different institutions that capture perceptions of corruption within the past two years. 

The data sources are standardized to a scale of 0-100 where a 0 equals the highest level of perceived corruption and 100 equals the lowest level of perceived corruption.

Display_Name: Control of Corruption
Description: These aggregated indicators combine the views of a large number of enterprise, citizen and expert survey respondents in industrial and developing countries.  The WGI compile and summarize information from over 30 existing data sources that report the views and experiences of citizens, entrepreneurs, and experts in the public, private and NGO sectors from around the world, on the quality of various aspects of governance.

Display_Name: Consensus on goals
Description: The Transformation Index network of 248 experts from 129 countries assess about the extent to which a total of 17 criteria have been met for each country. Read more about the methodology in the Metadata and Resources section.

Display_Name: Civil justice is effectively enforced
Description: The World Justice Project developed the conceptual framework summarized in the Index's 9 factors and 47 sub-factors, in consultation with academics, practitioners, and community leaders from around the world. The Index team developed a set of five questionnaires based on the Index's conceptual framework, to be administered to experts and the general public.

Display_Name: Business Environment
Description: The 2017 IIAG Ibrahim Index of African Governance covers the entire continent, 54 countries. It consists of 100 indicators built up into 4 categories: Safety & Rule of Law, Participation & Human Rights, Sustainable Economic Opportunity and Human Development. It includes four data types from 36 different sources: Qualitative Assessment, Opinion Surveys, Official Data and Public Attitude Survey.

Display_Name: Enrollment reporting to UNESCO
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Description: PEFA includes 31 performance indicators across the broad array of PFM activities performed by governments. The indicators are grouped under the seven pillars. Each pillar comprises a group of indicators that capture the performance of the key systems, processes, and institutions of government.

Display_Name: Health surveys
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Rule of Law
Description: These aggregated indicators combine the views of a large number of enterprise, citizen and expert survey respondents in industrial and developing countries.  The WGI compile and summarize information from over 30 existing data sources that report the views and experiences of citizens, entrepreneurs, and experts in the public, private and NGO sectors from around the world, on the quality of various aspects of governance.

Description: PEFA includes 31 performance indicators across the broad array of PFM activities performed by governments. The indicators are grouped under the seven pillars. Each pillar comprises a group of indicators that capture the performance of the key systems, processes, and institutions of government.

Display_Name: National immunization coverage
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Budgetary Policy
Description: The Sustainable Governance Indicators (SGI) draw on established survey and aggregation methods. In order to ensure the proper operationalization of the individual index components, the SGI relies on a combination of qualitative and quantitative data.

Display_Name: Regulatory Quality
Description: These aggregated indicators combine the views of a large number of enterprise, citizen and expert survey respondents in industrial and developing countries.  The WGI compile and summarize information from over 30 existing data sources that report the views and experiences of citizens, entrepreneurs, and experts in the public, private and NGO sectors from around the world, on the quality of various aspects of governance.

Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Description: The 2017 IIAG Ibrahim Index of African Governance covers the entire continent, 54 countries. Description:
The CPI 2017 is calculated using 13 different data sources from 12 different institutions that capture perceptions of corruption within the past two years. 

The data sources are standardized to a scale of 0-100 where a 0 equals the highest level of perceived corruption and 100 equals the lowest level of perceived corruption.

Description: PEFA includes 31 performance indicators across the broad array of PFM activities performed by governments. The indicators are grouped under the seven pillars. Each pillar comprises a group of indicators that capture the performance of the key systems, processes, and institutions of government.

Display_Name: Statistical Capacity Indicator
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: CPI Score
Description:
The CPI 2017 is calculated using 13 different data sources from 12 different institutions that capture perceptions of corruption within the past two years. 

The data sources are standardized to a scale of 0-100 where a 0 equals the highest level of perceived corruption and 100 equals the lowest level of perceived corruption.

Display_Name: Agricultural census
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Rank
Description:
The CPI 2017 is calculated using 13 different data sources from 12 different institutions that capture perceptions of corruption within the past two years. 

The data sources are standardized to a scale of 0-100 where a 0 equals the highest level of perceived corruption and 100 equals the lowest level of perceived corruption.

Display_Name: Government Finance accounting concept
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

The Global Competitiveness Report 2015–2016 presents information and data that were compiled and/or collected by the World Economic Forum.
It is grouped into 12 categories, the pillars of competitiveness: Institutions, Infrastructure, Macroeconomic environment, Health and primary education, Higher education and training, Goods market efficiency, Labor market efficiency, Financial market development, Technological readiness, Market size, Business sophistication, Innovation.

Display_Name: Population Census
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Negotiating Public Support
Description: The Sustainable Governance Indicators (SGI) draw on established survey and aggregation methods. In order to ensure the proper operationalization of the individual index components, the SGI relies on a combination of qualitative and quantitative data.

Display_Name: Control of Corruption
Description: These aggregated indicators combine the views of a large number of enterprise, citizen and expert survey respondents in industrial and developing countries.  The WGI compile and summarize information from over 30 existing data sources that report the views and experiences of citizens, entrepreneurs, and experts in the public, private and NGO sectors from around the world, on the quality of various aspects of governance.

Display_Name: Vital Registration
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

Display_Name: Rule of Law
Description: These aggregated indicators combine the views of a large number of enterprise, citizen and expert survey respondents in industrial and developing countries.  The WGI compile and summarize information from over 30 existing data sources that report the views and experiences of citizens, entrepreneurs, and experts in the public, private and NGO sectors from around the world, on the quality of various aspects of governance.

Display_Name: Registering Property Geographic coverage

Display_Name: External debt reporting
Description: The World Bank's Statistical Capacity Indicator is a composite score assessing the capacity of a country's statistical system. It is based on a diagnostic framework assessing the following areas: methodology, data sources, and periodicity and timeliness. Countries are scored against 25 criteria in these areas, using publicly available information and/or country input. The overall Statistical Capacity score is then being calculated as simple average of all three area scores on a scale of 0-100.

The Global Competitiveness Report 2015–2016 presents information and data that were compiled and/or collected by the World Economic Forum.

Display_Name: Demographic Pressures
Description: The Failed States Index is an annual ranking of 177 countries across 12 indicators. Each indicator is based on data from three main streams - pre-existing quantitative data sets, content analysis, and qualitative expert analysis. The data is triangulated and subjected to critical review to obtain final scores for the Index.

Display_Name: In law citizens have a right to form NGOs focused on anticorruption or good governance (01a)
Description:
Global Integrity quantitatively assesses the access that citizens and businesses have to a country's government, their ability to monitor its behavior, and their ability to seek redress and advocate for improved governance.

It breaks down that access into a number of categories and questions, ranging from inquiries into electoral practices and media freedom to budget transparency and conflicts of interests regulations.

Global Integrity quantitatively assesses the access that citizens and businesses have to a country's government, their ability to monitor its behavior, and their ability to seek redress and advocate for improved governance.

Description: Transparency International's Global Corruption Barometer (TIGBC) is the largest world-wide public opinion survey on corruption. Significantly, the Barometer also provides insights into how willing and ready people are to act to stop corruption.
